docs.snippet: ALBANY, N.Y., Oct 18 -- Last June Charles F. Peek, the cat's-paw Labor Commissioner of David B. Hill, suddenly left for Europe, while his trial for destroying public papers of his office was pending. His bail bond of $100 was declared forfeited, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, N.Y., Oct 18 -- Last June Charles F. Peek, the cat's-paw Labor Commissioner of David B. Hill, suddenly left for Europe, while his trial for destroying public papers of his office was pending. His bail bond of $100 was declared forfeited, and bench warrants were issued, but the bondsmen were never prosecuted, as it was supposed that Peek would return.

headline.main: CHARLES F. PECK SURRENDERS.; The Late Labor Commissioner Returns to Stand His Trial.

docs.snippet: The steamship Alene of the Atlas Line yesterday brought to this port the boat of the Alvo that was picked up by the steamship Jason on her voyage to Montego Bay. Capt. Seiders of the Alene took the lifeboat on board at Kingston, where it was left ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Alene of the Atlas Line yesterday brought to this port the boat of the Alvo that was picked up by the steamship Jason on her voyage to Montego Bay. Capt. Seiders of the Alene took the lifeboat on board at Kingston, where it was left by the Jason.

headline.main: ALVO'S BOAT BROUGHT TO PORT.; Capt. Seiders of the Alene Thinks the Steamship Sank in Collision.

headline.main: VESSELS THAT NEVER CAME BACK.; List of Ships That Were Lost in the Recent Great Storms.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 19 -- The Dutch steamer P. Caland, Capt. De Boer, from Rotterdam Sept. 9 for New-York, was spoken Sept. 17 in latitude 50 north, longitude 24 west. She was then proceeding for Plymouth, having in tow the Dutch steamer Maasdam, Capt. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 19 -- The Dutch steamer P. Caland, Capt. De Boer, from Rotterdam Sept. 9 for New-York, was spoken Sept. 17 in latitude 50 north, longitude 24 west. She was then proceeding for Plymouth, having in tow the Dutch steamer Maasdam, Capt. Potjor, which sailed from Rotterdam Sept. 6 for New-York.

headline.main: STEAMER MAASDAM DISABLED.; Her Crankpin Broken -- Under Tow for Plymouth with Over 400 Passengers.
ON A RAFT WITHOUT FOOD.; Torturing Experience of the Crew of the Jonathan May.

docs.snippet: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 24. -- A ship wreck attended by the loss of seventeen lives occurred in the big storm this morning off this point....
docs.lead_paragraph: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 24. -- A ship wreck attended by the loss of seventeen lives occurred in the big storm this morning off this point.

headline.main: SEVENTEEN WERE DROWNED.; Only Three Men Came Ashore Alive from the Ocean Tug Panther.

docs.snippet: To wing on the ocean is not the sort of job that conservative seamen, especially those who have had experiences with straining bitts and whipping hawsers, are likely to grow enthusiastic about. If either vessel is anyway handicapped, and a gale be...
docs.abstract: Wandrahm Stranded Near Quebec; Towed to New-York
docs.lead_paragraph: To wing on the ocean is not the sort of job that conservative seamen, especially those who have had experiences with straining bitts and whipping hawsers, are likely to grow enthusiastic about. If either vessel is anyway handicapped, and a gale besets the tow, the chances are that one or both will add their names to the roll of missing ships.

headline.main: ATTEMPTED TO HOLD THE SHIP; QUEBEC WORKMEN ANGRY OVER LOSING THE WANDRAHM. They Thought Repairs to the Badly-Injured Steamer Would Give Them Word for a Year -- Violence Threatened When Americans Were Sent to Tow Her Away -- The Ship Finally Moved Out to Sea Where She Encountered Much Bad Weather -- Brought to New-York in Safety.

docs.snippet: The Long Branch steamer Mary Patten on her return trip to this city last night from Long Branch became disabled off Sandy Hook by the breaking of the walking beam, and did not reach the Battery wharf until after midnight....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Long Branch steamer Mary Patten on her return trip to this city last night from Long Branch became disabled off Sandy Hook by the breaking of the walking beam, and did not reach the Battery wharf until after midnight.

headline.main: PANIC-ON THE MARY PATTEN; PASSENGERS IN A MAD FIGHT FOR LIFE-PRESERVERS. The Frame of the Walking Beam Broke on the Trip from Long Branch to This City and the Mass of Metal Went Crashing Into the Hold -- Women and Children Were Trampled On in the Rush, but Fright Was Soon Allayed -- No One Seriously Hurt.

docs.snippet: About 100 women with their races painted with a creamy white color that completely concealed the rose and tan which the sun and ocean breezes had imparted to their cheeks, landed at the Iron Steamboat Company's pier not far from midnight, Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: About 100 women with their races painted with a creamy white color that completely concealed the rose and tan which the sun and ocean breezes had imparted to their cheeks, landed at the Iron Steamboat Company's pier not far from midnight, Tuesday. Their dresses also were liberally, if not artistically frescoed with the paint.

headline.main: DAUBED WITH FRESH WHITE PAINT; Unpleasant Consequences to Passengers of a Slight Mishap to the Pegasus.
LOST WITH ALL ON BOARD.; THE THRACIAN, WITH TWENTY-TWO MEN, FOUNDERS IN ENGLISH WATERS.
